intro: Keniochloa hedbergii, commonly known as the Hedberg's keniochloa, is a species of grass native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Poaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils, often in humid, tropical environments. It has small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in spikelets, typical of the grass family. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
